_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Equalizer Incorporated owns and operates an agricutural feed and fertilizer facility in Lacy Lakeview TX, a suburb of Waco TX. The facility is subject to the Environmental Protection Agency's Risk Managment Program rule under the Clean Air Act ammendments of 1990.

  The Risk Management Program rule requires a facility which handles threshold amounts of certain chemical substances to develop a program (if one is not already in existence) to prevent accidential release of these substances and to minimize the consequences of releases that do occur. 

  The following is a summary of the Risk Managment Plan for Equalizer Inc. Waco, TX.

  The Equalizer Inc. terminal serves as a storage and distribution terminal for liquid fertilizer products and the blending and distribution of liquid cattle feeds. In addition to storage, blending and distribution, the Equalizer Inc. location is used for the processing of Ammonium-Poly-Phosphate fertilizer using a portable polyphosphate blender. The Equalizer Inc. facility serves as a vital link in the fertilizer distribution system by storing and delivering products in close proximity to central Texas agricultural producers. 
Anhydrous ammonia is the only regulated substance handled at the Equalizer facility that is subject to the requirments of the Risk Managment Program rule. The Anhydrous ammonia is received by rail in pressurized cars when it is quickly processed into liquid AmmoniumPolyPhosphate using a portable T reactor. The AmmoniumPolyPhosphate is stored in above ground tanks until needed by agrcultural producers. In addition to being used as a crop nutriant, the AmmoniumPolyphosphate is used as source of Phosphorus and NPN in liquid cattle feed suppliments.

  It is the policy of Equalizer Inc to eliminate significant accidental releases of any substances and particularly any of a hazardous or regulated substance. Prevention of accidental releases is critical to the safe opperation of the facility, to the safety of its empl

oyees and to the safety of the general public. 

  Equalizer Inc has a written Emergency Action Plan as required and is committed to the implementation of the plan in response to any accidental release in a effort to minimize the impact to employees, the community, and the environment. The Emergency Action Plan is co-ordinated with Lacy Lakeview LEPC and local response agencies. Our employees are trained in the appropriate response activities that would be required in the event of an emergency.

  Emergency Planning and Community Right to know information under SARA Title III has been provided to local 
and state emergency planning committees and to local fire departments. Equalizer Inc has had no RMP program reportable accidents within the last five years. 

Safety improvements continue to occur as part of an ongoing process and re-evaluation of the Hazard Analysis.
